definition: once/already/ever (in the past)/former/previously/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
Xuanzang (602-664) Tang dynasty Buddhist monk and translator, who traveled to India 629-645
lit. many monks and not much gruel (idiom)/fig. not enough to go around/demand exceeds supply
poor monk (humble term used by monk of himself)
see 僧多粥少[seng1 duo1 zhou1 shao3]
lit. not for the monk's sake but for the Buddha's sake (idiom)/fig. (to do sth for sb) out of deference to sb else
pinyin: bu4 kan4 seng1 mian4 kan4 fo2 mian4

definition: Coraciiformes, class of birds including kingfishers and hornbills

sentences.english: Have faith and confidence in the Triple Gem.
sentences.chinese: 具足信对佛法僧的信心与敬心。

sentences.english: The first Sudirman Cup competition was held in indonesia in 1989 .
sentences.chinese: 第一苏迪曼杯赛正在印度僧西亚于1989年进行。

sentences.english: To be neither fish, nor flesh, nor fowl
sentences.chinese: 食鱼肉的话是僧，只吃肉的是俗人。

sentences.english: Li Shutong becomes a monk and stays at the Hupao Monastery with Hongyi as his Buddhist name.
sentences.chinese: 李叔同到杭州虎跑寺出家为僧，法号弘一法师。

sentences.english: The legend of the Shaolin monks began around 1, 500 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 少林僧的传奇开始于1500年前。

sentences.english: The Sangha members represent the living embodiment of the Dhamma. They uphold the responsibility of preserving and propagating Buddhism.
sentences.chinese: 僧团体现了佛佗的教法，也负责维护与宣导佛教。

sentences.english: Monk Zhao s theory of "Bu Zhen Kong Lun" is to deal with the problem concerning ontology.
sentences.chinese: 僧肇的《不真空论》论述的是“空”这一本体论问题。

sentences.english: Hawaiian monk seal on the beach in Kauai.
sentences.chinese: 一只僧海豹躺在夏威夷，考艾岛的沙滩上。

sentences.english: The monks think stone beast down the water flowing downwards.
sentences.chinese: 僧人们认为石兽顺着水流往下流去了。

sentences.english: The same is the case with the virtues of Dharma and Sangha.
sentences.chinese: 这同样适用于法和僧的美德的例子。

sentences.english: When Hu was six or seven years old, he asked his father and mother if he could become a monk.
sentences.chinese: 胡六七岁的时候，问他父母可不可以让他出家为僧。

sentences.english: She at once went to the hut of the monk and burned it down.
sentences.chinese: 她立马去到僧寮，将它烧为白地。

sentences.english: If satisfied Shanseng see Office Solutions Direct Rao know Dayton forget, still a layman.
sentences.chinese: 若纳山僧见处，直饶知解顿忘，犹是门外汉。

sentences.english: Han Shanzi was a very important figure in terms of Buddhist poems.
sentences.chinese: 在僧诗创作历史上，寒山子是一个关键性人物。

sentences.english: The Sangha is my foremost refuge.
sentences.chinese: 我别无归依，僧是我的至上归依。

definition: name in religion (of Buddhist or Daoist within monastery)
one of three fabled islands in Eastern sea, abode of immortals
square zhang (i.e. unit of area 10 feet square)/monastic room 10 feet square/Buddhist or Daoist abbot/abbot's chamber
lama, spiritual teacher in Tibetan Buddhism
name in religion (of Buddhist or Daoist within monastery)/same as 法號|法号[fa3 hao4]
monk (Sanskrit: Sramana, originally refers to north India)/Buddhist monk
death/to pass away (of Buddhist monks, nuns etc)
